Game.Name: Back to the Future Part II (Europe)
Game.plot: Back to the Future II is a collection of five arcade and puzzle games.Based on the second installment of the popular Hollywood series Back to the Future, this movie conversion has Marty McFly and Doc Brown travel through time to stop their arch-rival Biff from changing the future. The game consists of five parts, each inspired by one of the movie's most memorable scenes:1. Hoverboard Chase: A Paperboy clone without newspapers, but with isometric levels and lots of enemies to dodge.2. Jennifer Rescue: Guide Marty's girlfriend Jennifer out of the house without her meeting one of the four family members. Open and close doors to make the persons go from one room to the next in this top-down puzzle sequence.3. Beat Biff: A side-scrolling beat-em-up sequence in the tradition of Double Dragon. Fight your way through a grim 1985 by jumping, hitting and kicking at Biff's lackeys.4. Band Puzzle: Rearrange the mixed-up parts of an animated picture of the school band in this sliding block puzzle. The clock is ticking.5. Hoverboard Chase 2: Another hoverboard sequence, similar to the first one, only this time set in 1955.Cheat: Unlimited livesIf you fail at the Bonus Rounds (levels 2 & 4), it takes a life away from you, but will not give you game over and allow you to continue on. You can use this to your advantage. Either in the first or third level, allow yourself to lose all but your very last life, and then beat the level. Lose the following bonus intentionally. Your lives will say zero, but you can die over and over again and never get a game over! This is handy for the very difficult final stage.Cheat: Easy level skipAt any stage of the game, press Pause and then press Up and Down on the d-pad.
Game.Notes: It's time to go back... Great Scott! Returning from the year 2015, Doc Emmet Brown has some bad news for Marty McFly... His future's in danger unless he can put things right. Guide Marty through five levels in this exciting interpretation of the smash-hit film. Can you assure a safe future for Marty? Or will Biff ensure there's no future at all?
